item.title: Node / Node.JS
item.description: What is Node? Nodes in the DOM are elements from the HTML page, which are organized in a hiearchical tree-like structure consisting of parents and children. Elements such as <p>, <div>, <section> are considered as “element” nodes while comments are “comment” nodes, “text” objects and line-breaks are “text” nodes. Every HTML element is a node, but not every node is an HTML element. The topmost node is the root node of the DOM tree, Document, which has two children: <!
